const SDL_version * CFG_LinkedVersion(void)
Version of the dynamically linked SDL_Config library.
No testing, just outputs what was passed in.
Critical library errors shouldn’t ever happen, so if you encounter one of them, you must be doing sth really weird.
CFG_Internal_EntryMapItor multi_value_iterator
It’s a “pointer” to entry which is used for multi value iteration.
Uint32 next_entry_order
Next created entry will have such order.
Uint32 next_group_order
Next created group will have such order.
bool Open(const char *filename,  
const CFG_Settings *settings =  0)
Essentialy the same thing as CFG_File::CFG_OpenFile.
int CFG_OpenFile(CFG_String_Arg filename,  
CFG_File *file,  
const CFG_Settings *settings =  0)
Opens and parses file.
int CFG_OpenFile_RW(SDL_RWops *source,  
CFG_File *file,  
const CFG_Settings *settings =  0)
The same as CFG_OpenFile, the only difference is that it loads file directly from SDL_RWops stream.
Uint32 order
Used to sort entries during save operation in the same order as in file they were originally read from.
Uint32 order
Used to sort groups during save operation in order as in file they were originally read from.
CFG_Internal_OriginalFileGroupMapItor original_group_iterator
If you’re iterating over groups in original order, after every change in functions that iterate, it’s dereferenced and its value is assigned to selected_group.
CFG_Internal_OriginalFileGroupMap * original_groups
Contains all groups (the same as groups) sorted in order in which they were found in cfg file.
void PerformValueSubstitution(CFG_Bool recheck_types =  false)
Essentialy the same thing as CFG_File::CFG_PerformValueSubstitution.
void CFG_PerformValueSubstitution(CFG_Bool recheck_types =  false)
Searches for entries which value depends on another entry, and performs necessary substitutions.
CFG_String post_comment
String which is holding comment that was found after entry definition, ie.
CFG_String post_comment
String which is holding comment that was found after group definition, ie.
Uint8 post_comment_type
Currently for padding, maybe in later versions it will contain type of post comment (now it’s not needed).
CFG_String pre_comment
String which is holding comment that was found before entry definition, ie.
CFG_String pre_comment
String which is holding comment that was found before group definition, ie.
Uint8 pre_comment_type
Uint8 pre_comment_type
If defined, library will generate output to stdout about how much miliseconds it took to Open/Save files.
bool Read (CFG_String_Arg entry,
CFG_Bool defaultVal)
Overloaded versions of ReadBool etc.
Essentialy the same thing as CFG_ReadBool, CFG_ReadInt, CFG_ReadFloat, CFG_ReadText.
If defined, you can change bool keywords.
CFG_Bool remove_group_spaces
Determines whether spaces from within group declarations will be removed.
Essentialy the same thing as CFG_RemoveBoolEntry, CFG_RemoveIntEntry, CFG_RemoveFloatEntry, CFG_RemoveTextEntry.
int RemoveGroup(CFG_String_Arg group)
Essentialy the same thing as CFG_File::CFG_RemoveGroup.
int CFG_RemoveGroup(CFG_String_Arg group)
Removes group with appropriate name.
void RemoveMultiValueEntry()
Essentialy the same thing as CFG_File::CFG_RemoveMultiValueEntry.
void CFG_RemoveMultiValueEntry(void)
Removes currently selected entry from multiple value list iteration.
void RemoveSelectedEntry()
Essentialy the same thing as CFG_File::CFG_RemoveSelectedEntry.
void CFG_RemoveSelectedEntry(void)
Removes the currently selected entry (during iteration).
void RemoveSelectedGroup()
Essentialy the same thing as CFG_File::CFG_RemoveSelectedGroup.
void CFG_RemoveSelectedGroup(void)
Removes currently selected group.
